newsitem.title: USA: Cross Timbers completes gas acquisitions.
newsitem.headline: Cross Timbers completes gas acquisitions.

text.p: Cross Timbers Oil Co said Wednesday it has completed the acquisition of natural gas producing properties in Texas and Wyoming for $40.5 million, boosting their reserves by about 58 billion cubic feet (bcf).

The Permian Basin properties in West Texas, located in the northern Val Verde area, were purchased from various limited partnerships formed by New York Life Insurance Co and American Exploration Co, the company said.

Estimated proved reserves at the Texas properties are 33 bcf of gas and 300,000 barrels of oil. Daily production has been estimated at eight million cubic feet per day (mmcfd) of gas and 73 barrels of oil from 176 gross, or 72 net, wells.
Cross Timbers said it is not the sole owner of each well.

Reserves at the Wyoming properties in the Green River Basin, which were purchased from FMC Corp, have been estimated at 25 bcf of natural gas with current production averaging 1.8 mmcfd from 71 gross (13.7 net) wells.
The purchase includes additional interests in the Cross Timbers-operated Fontenelle unit in Wyoming, which was acquired by Cross Timbers earlier this year.
The company will now own more than 97 percent of the Fontenelle unit and 100 percent of the related gathering and compression facilities.
The purchase of the Texas and Wyoming wells are being funded using bank credit lines, a company official said.
